title: THEORIA dataset global assumptions
description: Schema for the global assumptions file that contains centralized physics assumptions referenced by entries.

assumptions.description: Array of global assumptions that can be referenced by entries. Each assumption represents a core principle, empirical fact, or approximation used in physics derivations.

id.description: Unique identifier for the assumption. Use lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores only. Choose descriptive names that clearly identify the assumption.

text.description: Clear, concise description of the assumption. If there are math symbols or equations, they must be enclosed in backticks (``) and written in AsciiMath format.
text.example: Classical mechanics framework: relativistic effects negligible (v << c), quantum effects negligible for macroscopic bodies

type.description: Type of assumption: principle (core mathematical/theoretical principles postulated or derived from basic theories), empirical (experimentally established facts and measured constants), approximation (modeling assumptions that restrict validity or simplify analysis, including regime restrictions and simplifying approximations)

mathematical_expressions.description: Optional array of mathematical expressions that formalize this assumption using AsciiMath format.

symbol_definitions.description: Definitions for all symbols used in mathematical_expressions. Required if mathematical_expressions is provided.

definition.description: Clear definition of what the symbol represents

used_in.description: Array of entry IDs that reference this assumption. This field tracks which dataset entries use this assumption in their derivations or explanations.

items.description: Entry ID (result_id) that uses this assumption
